arm_group.description: 48 morbidly obese patients with revisional gastric bypass

brief_summary.textblock:
This study compared revisional malabsorptive laparoscopic very very long limb gastric bypass
      (VVLL RYGB) with primary VVLL RYGB and tested the hypothesis that one staged revisional
      laparoscopic VVLL RYGB is a safe and effective procedure after failed restrictive gastric
      banding.

clinical_study.brief_title: Revisional Versus Primary Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass: a Case Matched Analysis
clinical_study.condition: Effect of Revisional Surgery for Failed Gastric Banding

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Primary Gastric Bypass according to SMOB (Swiss group for the study of morbid
             obesity) Guidelines

          -  Revisional Gastric Bypass after failed Gastric Banding

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  According to SMOB Criteria

clinical_study.official_title: Revisional Versus Primary Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass: a Case Matched Analysis

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Retrospective
